title: Anthropologie’s Sold-Out Valentine’s Day Glasses Are Back for 2025 (They’re So Cute!)
description: Snag ‘em fast before they’re gone again. READ MORE...
author: Blair Donovan
excerpt: Snag ‘em fast before they’re gone again.
text: DecoratingDecor & AccessoriesShoppingBlair DonovanSenior Editor of StyleBlair DonovanSenior Editor of StyleAs AT’s Senior Style Editor, I cover the latest interior design trends, expert decorating ideas, and must-see home products. Whenever I’m not keeping tabs on the next TikTok “core” or buzzy IKEA collection, I’m most likely reading, online shopping, or looking for the best tacos in New York (recs are encouraged).published yesterdayWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Credit: JHVEPhoto/ShutterstockValentine’s Day decor doesn’t have to be all hearts and pink-and-red everything (unless you want it to, of course). Case in point? Anthropologie’s crowd-favorite $16 juice glasses are back in stores for 2025, and they’re so cute that you can use them year-round.Anthropologie’s Icon Juice Glasses originally went viral a few years ago for their cute Halloween-themed design, and they’ve continued to roll out new iterations for various holidays and seasons. Now, for Valentine’s Day, the brand has brought back glasses with adorable heart motifs in a handful of colors, as well as styles with bows and little red lips that nod to February 14.   Each 17.25-ounce round glass has been handblown with decorative beads pressed into the exterior. These little icons add a unique, colorful touch to simple everyday drinking glasses. And beyond just Valentine’s Day-inspired accents, the Icon Juice Glasses come in 20 different designs total — from quirky horseshoe accents to cherries and rainbows.While these glasses are adorable, just know that they can only be hand-washed, and they’re not recommended for hot beverages. That said, they make drinking iced coffee, cocktails, juice, or even water feel, well, fun. Anthropologie shoppers agree, too — this collection has 4.8 stars and almost 2,100 reviews. One person described the Icon Juice Glasses as “classic and versatile,” while another added that they “have 6 of the cups and love them all.”The Icon Juice Glasses are sold individually, so you can mix and match a set for your barware display or even gift a few to your Galentines that fit their style preferences. Either way, act fast — because if history repeats itself, this Anthropologie find is bound to sell out ASAP!
html:
• Decorating
  • Decor & Accessories
  • Shopping

Blair DonovanSenior Editor of Style

Blair DonovanSenior Editor of Style

As AT’s Senior Style Editor, I cover the latest interior design trends, expert decorating ideas, and must-see home products. Whenever I’m not keeping tabs on the next TikTok “core” or buzzy IKEA collection, I’m most likely reading, online shopping, or looking for the best tacos in New York (recs are encouraged).

published yesterday

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

Valentine’s Day decor doesn’t have to be all hearts and pink-and-red everything (unless you want it to, of course). Case in point? Anthropologie’s crowd-favorite $16 juice glasses are back in stores for 2025, and they’re so cute that you can use them year-round.

Anthropologie’s Icon Juice Glasses originally went viral a few years ago for their cute Halloween-themed design, and they’ve continued to roll out new iterations for various holidays and seasons. Now, for Valentine’s Day, the brand has brought back glasses with adorable heart motifs in a handful of colors, as well as styles with bows and little red lips that nod to February 14.   

Each 17.25-ounce round glass has been handblown with decorative beads pressed into the exterior. These little icons add a unique, colorful touch to simple everyday drinking glasses. And beyond just Valentine’s Day-inspired accents, the Icon Juice Glasses come in 20 different designs total — from quirky horseshoe accents to cherries and rainbows.

While these glasses are adorable, just know that they can only be hand-washed, and they’re not recommended for hot beverages. That said, they make drinking iced coffee, cocktails, juice, or even water feel, well, fun. Anthropologie shoppers agree, too — this collection has 4.8 stars and almost 2,100 reviews. One person described the Icon Juice Glasses as “classic and versatile,” while another added that they “have 6 of the cups and love them all.”

The Icon Juice Glasses are sold individually, so you can mix and match a set for your barware display or even gift a few to your Galentines that fit their style preferences. Either way, act fast — because if history repeats itself, this Anthropologie find is bound to sell out ASAP!
